title: Taliban Is Denied Foreign Aid but Taps Billion-Dollar Drug Trade
summary: The U.S. and its Western allies are blocking billions of dollars in financial assistance to the group, which has black-market operations to sustain it. The Biden administration is set to cut off the Taliban's access to billions of dollars in critical overseas finance, but some officials warn that the terror-group's income from drug sales and other illicit activities threatens to undermine Washington's last-resort pressure campaign.

title: Walmart Taps Another Former Justice Department Official for Compliance Role
summary: Matt Miner, a former deputy assistant attorney general for the U.S. Justice Department, will serve as Walmart's chief compliance officer. Walmart Inc. has hired a former official from the U.S. Justice Department's criminal division as compliance chief, as the retail giant fights a civil lawsuit over its prescription practices.

title: Covid-19 Boosters to Be Offered to Pfizer, Moderna Recipients
summary: Biden administration unveils broad booster program, citing threat posed by Delta variant. The Biden administration took steps Wednesday to crack down on rising Covid-19 cases, including a call for a third shot starting this fall for adults who were fully vaccinated with the two-shot regimen.

title: Nvidia's Doing Just Fine on Its Own
summary: Gaming, data center businesses booming even as chipmaker shifts tone on Arm deal. All slowdowns should look like this.

title: Operator of Helix Bitcoin 'Mixer' Pleads Guilty
summary: Larry Dean Harmon, who allegedly laundered $300 million in crypto on Darknet markets, will forfeit more than 4,400 bitcoins-worth $200 million-and could face up to 20 years in prison. An operator of a bitcoin "mixer" has pleaded guilty to conspiracy to launder money, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.

title: EPA Bans Pesticide Deemed Harmful to Children's Brains
summary: The insecticide chlorpyrifos is used in agriculture on crops including soybeans, almond trees and grapes. WASHINGTON-The Environmental Protection Agency is banning a farm pesticide widely used to control crop pests, which it says is toxic to children's brains.

title: Road Trips, Falling Crude Prices Pump Up Refiners' Profits
summary: Refiners are benefiting from surging gasoline demand, but investors remain wary because of rising costs for meeting environmental rules. Summer road trips and a pullback in crude prices have pumped up refineries' profits, offering brighter prospects for one part of the global oil complex despite rising worries about Covid-19.

title: ATL Partners Backs Space Technology Provider Geost
summary: Geost develops sensors that detect and prevent threats to satellites and other assets in space. Private-equity firm ATL Partners has acquired a majority stake in space technology provider Geost LLC as the U.S. and its allies focus more of their defense efforts on outer space.

title: The IMF Acts Against the Taliban
summary: Afghanistan was in line to receive more than $400 million in Special Drawing Rights next week.. Among the thousands of refugees fleeing Kabul was the acting governor of Afghanistan's central bank, Ajmal Ahmady. He tweeted his escape and noted that he was told Taliban fighters were going door to door demanding to know where he was.

title: The Coup That Failed-but Toppled Communism
summary: Soviet hard-liners could have crushed the resistance 30 years ago, but they lacked the will.. As dawn broke on Aug. 19, 1991, tanks and armored cars converged on Moscow and Soviet citizens received the stunning news that President Mikhail Gorbachev had been overthrown in a coup. At 6:06 a.m., the news agency Tass announced that he had been removed for reasons of health, and power was in the hands of a shadowy group calling itself the State Committee for the Emergency Situation.

title: Robinhood Revenue Surges on Cryptocurrency Trades
summary: Trading app posted a $502 million loss in second quarter due to an emergency funding deal. Revenue at Robinhood Markets Inc. more than doubled in the second quarter thanks to a torrent of customers trading cryptocurrency, but the company posted a big loss due to an emergency funding deal earlier this year.

title: Biden Tells Nursing Homes to Vaccinate Staffs to Keep Medicare, Medicaid Funds
summary: Administration is taking more forceful action to scale up Covid-19 inoculations throughout the U.S.. President Biden said his administration will require nursing homes to vaccinate their staff against Covid-19 or risk losing Medicare and Medicaid funding.

title: A Fix for Atlanta's Voting Problems
summary: A Fulton County probe could end in a state takeover-or reform.. As Georgia probes Fulton County's election (mis)management, the best response from partisans would be to take a deep breath. This is about accountability for a long record of mistakes. It isn't about President Trump's specious fraud claims, and it isn't a threat to democracy.

title: Three Cheers for Vaccine Boosters
summary: Biden is right to ignore criticism from the WHO on a third mRNA shot.. Give the Biden Administration credit for endorsing Covid booster shots in defiance of the World Health Organization scolds who have been wrong on nearly every major public health issue during the pandemic.

title: Hooked on Federal Checks
summary: I'll take the $948 the IRS put in my bank account-but I feel bad about it.. Deposits of $948 hit my bank account on July 15 and Aug. 13. The money came from the Internal Revenue Service, but it isn't a tax refund. I shouldn't be getting this money at all.

title: U.S. Keeps My Family in Covid Lockdown
summary: Biden extended a Trump order blocking our return if we visit family in Britain.. My wife and I arrived in New York in May 2019 with our children, then 2, 5 and 9. They haven't seen their grandparents since. So it came as a huge relief last month when the U.K. announced that fully vaccinated British expats living in the U.S. could return home without quarantining.

title: Democrats Will Soon Play Texas Fold 'Em
summary: The legislators who fled to block a voting bill are about to get their bluff called.. The drama in Texas over election reform is drawing to a close.

title: 'Stakeholder' Talk Proves Empty Again
summary: Two years after signing the Business Roundtable statement, companies still prioritize shareholders.. Corporate leaders have been busy presenting themselves as guardians of the interests of "stakeholders," such as customers, employees, suppliers and communities as well as shareholders. Our recent research, however, casts serious doubt on whether corporations are matching the talk with action.

title: The Taliban Capture Joe Biden
summary: Kabul's conquerors hold the leverage in defining the terms of a postwar status quo.. Meet the next member of the United Nations General Assembly: the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. New York City's commercial real-estate sector soon will be showing space available for the Taliban's U.N. delegation. This, in the world according to Joe Biden, is what normalcy looks like.

title: 'The Power of Trust' Review: When Reliable Is Proﬁtable
summary: Customers and investors alike feel cheated and apprehensive when companies violate basic business norms. There is a better way.. Ralph Waldo Emerson is rarely invoked when people are discussing business and national economies, but he captured a nice point when he observed that "distrust is very expensive." When individuals lack confidence in the quality and reliability of the products they're buying-from meatloaf to mutual funds-commercial exchange is impeded and economic growth thwarted. It's no coincidence that countries with high levels of distrust have high rates of poverty as well.

title: T-Mobile Says Hackers Stole Data on More Than 40 Million People
summary: Theft included Social Security numbers and driver's license data for current and prospective customers. T-Mobile US Inc. said hackers took the Social Security numbers and other personal information of more than 40 million current and prospective customers, a brazen heist that could give criminals the digital keys to commit widespread online fraud.

title: Caldor Fire in Northern California Forces Evacuations
summary: New blaze has exploded in size since beginning Monday, significantly damaging town of Grizzly Flats. A Northern California fire that began Monday has exploded in size, growing from 6,500 acres to 53,772 acres in just over a day.

title: Former Purdue President Distances Himself From OxyContin Sales Program
summary: Richard Sackler said he didn't recall most advice given by consulting firm McKinsey on the 'turbocharge' initiative, while denying Purdue Pharma's responsibility for the opioid crisis. Former Purdue Pharma LP president Richard Sackler distanced himself from a program pitched years ago by consulting giant McKinsey & Co. to increase OxyContin sales and denied that his family or the company are responsible for the opioid epidemic.

title: U.S. Officials in Germany Hit by Havana Syndrome
summary: Diplomats affected by mysterious symptoms express concerns about vulnerability of American staff posted overseas. BERLIN-At least two U.S. officials stationed in Germany sought medical treatment after developing symptoms of the mysterious health complaint known as Havana Syndrome, U.S. diplomats said.

title: Nvidia's Gaming Chips Drive Record Quarterly Results
summary: As demand remains high, company's profit nearly quadruples. Graphics-chip maker Nvidia Corp. benefited from continued hot demand for devices from computer videogamers and cryptocurrency miners, pushing its sales and profit to records in its most recent quarter.

title: CME and Cboe Stock Respond to Media Report of Deal Talks
summary: Exchange operator CME denies report that it made acquisition offer; Cboe shares jump 12% but finish the day lower. Shares of exchange operators CME Group Inc. and Cboe Global Markets Inc. swung Wednesday following a media report that the two Chicago-based companies were discussing a merger.

title: Officer in Breonna Taylor Shooting Seeks New Publisher
summary: Former Louisville, Ky., officer Jonathan Mattingly returns his advance, says he is exploring other options after distributor dropped his book in April. A former Louisville, Ky., police officer involved in last year's fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor has returned his book advance and is exploring his options, his former publisher, Post Hill Press LLC, said Wednesday.

title: The Shame of Leaving Afghan Allies Behind
summary: My interpreter is praying that he can hide and escape the Taliban.. Regarding "The Afghan Allies Left Behind" (Review & Outlook, Aug. 16): My interpreter, whom I'll call Karim, served side by side with us in Afghanistan on special-operations missions. He risked his life to support U.S. troops, fighting with us to reduce the Taliban presence and capture their leaders. While my unit fought on nine-month deployments, Karim fought alongside Americans for years straight, from 2012 to 2020.

title: How Many More U.S. Lives Was War in Afghanistan Worth?
summary: Nation-building at the barrel of a gun doesn't work, no matter the time or trillions we invest.. Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster-a man deeply implicated in America's two-decade, $2 trillion failure in Afghanistan-decries, along with co-author Bradley Bowman, President Biden's decision to end the misguided U.S. military involvement in Afghanistan ("In Afghanistan, the Tragic Toll of Delusion, op-ed," Aug. 16).

title: Small Reactors, Big Future for Nuclear Power
summary: Without clean nuclear, carbon-reduction goals cannot be met.. Far from merely being "shrunken nuclear reactors" with a smaller physical footprint, generation facilities will use advanced technology to operate at very low atmospheric pressure and use fuel and facility design that will be primarily "walkaway" safe ("Utilities Explore Mini Reactors," Business News, Aug. 3). This is a tremendous step forward with small modular reactor (SMR) engineering that relies on gravity and other passive methods to ensure these generators cannot become dangerously overheated.

title: How TikTok Made Pop Its the Toy of the Pandemic
summary: Resume Subscription. On a recent Saturday, 11-year-old Madison O'Keefe went on a hunt. According to a TikTok video, The Learning Express and The Teaching Room, a toy store in Morristown, N.J., carried dozens of varieties of Pop Its, fidget toys that mimic the sensation of popping bubble wrap and come in strawberry, avocado and unicorn shapes.

title: 'Big Pharma' Takes Enough Shots
summary: Government price controls will kill research and development.. I am so weary of the political left taking shots at all that is great about this country. The pejorative term "Big Pharma" irks me the most ("Biden Jabs at Pharma," Review & Outlook, Aug. 14). These companies have saved the lives of tens of millions and have made our quality of life so much better. Our ancestors lived with smallpox, polio, tetanus, hepatitis, influenza, whooping cough, measles, mumps and other death sentences that have all been eliminated or kept under control by pharmaceuticals.

title: As Delta Variant Spreads, a Covid-19 Treatment Is in Short Supply
summary: Demand for Genentech's tocilizumab, an anti-inflammatory drug also known as Actemra, has jumped as hospitalizations increase. An anti-inflammatory drug used to treat severe cases of Covid-19 is in short supply globally as infections and hospitalizations surge due to the highly transmissible Delta variant.

title: The Mets That I Remember
summary: Talk about an underdog.. William Silber's mention of the underdog Mets' 1969 World Series victory ("Books on Underdogs," Five Best, Aug. 14) reminds me of the classic evaluation of the Mets by a TV newscaster after an intrasquad game ended in a tie: "The Mets are so bad, they can't even beat themselves."

title: Stocks Decline Amid Fed Minutes, Earnings Reports
summary: Dow, S&P 500 retreat for a second day from records notched earlier in the week. U.S. stocks slid in the final hour of trading after minutes from the Federal Reserve's last meeting showed officials increasingly in agreement about pulling back on the central bank's asset purchases this year.

title: Slanted Article (Thursday Crossword, August 19)
Fed Signals Asset Purchases Likely to Slow This Year
summary: Officials debated timing, mechanics of plans to reduce $120 billion in monthly bond purchases at July meeting, minutes show. Federal Reserve officials last month indicated they were on track to begin reversing their easy-money policies later this year, despite lingering differences over when exactly to pull back support for an economy growing faster than they expected earlier in the year.

title: Best Dorm Room Ideas: Decorating Dos and Don'ts to Rule the School
summary: Design pros share tips for spiffing up standard campus digs-and recall the worst décor mistakes they've seen college students (or their parents) make. YOU REMEMBER the décor challenges your dorm room presented: particleboard furniture, bleak cinder-block walls and a roommate's unsavory decorating decisions. "The dormitory is decidedly unhomelike, yet it takes center stage for a substantial period of people's lives," said Carla Yanni, author of "Living on Campus: An Architectural History of the American Dormitory."

title: Trump Ally Ken Kurson Charged With Cybercrimes in New York
summary: Then-President Donald Trump pardoned the former New York Observer editor on related federal charges in January. The Manhattan district attorney's office charged former Trump ally Ken Kurson with cybercrimes on Wednesday, making him at least the third person pardoned by former President Donald Trump to face scrutiny from New York state prosecutors.

title: R. Kelly Trial Lawyers Deliver Opening Statements
summary: The R&B singer is charged with leading a criminal enterprise and using his entourage to recruit women and girls for sex. The trial of singer R. Kelly kicked off Wednesday with opening statements from federal prosecutors and defense lawyers in a sprawling racketeering case that charges the R&B star with leading a criminal enterprise for decades and using his entourage to recruit women and underage girls for sex.

title: Deposed Afghan President Ghani Turns Up in Emirates
summary: The U.A.E. said it welcomed Mr. Ghani and his family on humanitarian grounds, as some Afghan officials express a sense of betrayal. Deposed Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani, who fled the country as the Taliban surrounded the capital Kabul, has taken refuge in the United Arab Emirates, the Gulf state said Wednesday.

title: Female CLO Firm Founder Alleges Gender Discrimination After Being Fired
summary: Joyce DeLucca says Hayfin Capital Management sidelined and pushed her out after buying her firm, while the U.K. asset manager says the allegations are without merit. Joyce DeLucca ran the investment firm she founded for 15 years from her Midtown Manhattan office, building it into a junk-debt specialist that at one point managed $3.6 billion. It was the third investment firm she launched in the fast-growing world of collateralized loan obligations.

title: Florida, Texas Turn to Antibody Treatments as Covid-19 Cases Surge
summary: The drugs from Regeneron, Eli Lilly and others went largely unused for months, but are embraced now to fight the latest coronavirus wave. Doctors are increasingly turning to antibody drugs in a bid to keep hospitals from being overwhelmed by a surge of Covid-19 cases, a turnabout after months in which the treatments went mostly unused.

title: Welcome to Springs, an East Hampton Enclave That's Not Like the Others
summary: Resume Subscription. Patrick Campion built a house in Amagansett in 2007 that he swore he would never leave. But when Richard Ziegelasch, his then-partner of just six months, asked him where he might consider moving, he had a quick answer: "Somewhere on the water."

title: What to Watch: Four Shows to Stream This Week
summary: 'Nine Perfect Strangers' go to a wellness retreat; Adrien Brody goes to 'Chapelwaite' and Amanda Peet makes 'The Chair'. This week we talk to creators and stars of three new series streaming this week. Bobby Cannavale tells us about lying in his own grave for "Nine Perfect Strangers"; Adrien Brody explains the imperfect hero of "Chapelwaite"; and Amanda Peet explains why she made a show about women who go first. Here's where to stream it all:

summary: The hamlet has been a quiet artists retreat. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

summary: A perfectly ripe apricot is exquisite-and rare. These jammy shortbread bars get intense flavor from dried fruit and other pantry staples. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.

title: Afghanistan's Taliban Rulers Meet Their First Political Protests With Gunfire
summary: At least two protesters trying to hoist Afghan republic's flag were gunned down in Jalalabad. The Taliban met with gunfire the first political protests they faced after seizing power in Afghanistan, killing at least two people and injuring several others as they dispersed demonstrators who waved the flag of the fallen Afghan republic.

title: Dessert to Go: An Easy, Portable Apricot Shortbread Recipe
summary: These jammy squares get intense flavor from dried fruit and other pantry staples. They're sturdy enough to tote to a barbecue or picnic, simple enough to make anytime.. IT'S RARE to find fragrant, juicy apricots, ripened in the sun and bursting with flavor. Thankfully, it's much easier to find soft, fragrant dried apricots. Indeed, this easy and highly adaptable recipe came about one afternoon when I returned home from the market hoping to bite into a perfect ripe apricot and instead found myself with tasteless, mealy fruit.

title: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett to Visit White House
summary: Leaders to discuss Iran, among other issues, according to Biden press secretary. Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett will meet with President Biden at the White House on Aug. 26, White House press secretary Jen Psaki said. The two leaders will discuss Iran, among other issues, Ms. Psaki said.

title: Will the Taliban Stop the Music in Afghanistan?
summary: After the group was ousted, music and music education thrived in the country; now that they're back, will they still?. The world witnessed the Taliban takeover of Kabul on Aug. 15, 2021. But we cannot yet imagine what this means for the people and culture of Afghanistan.

title: Pfizer's Covid-19 Booster Shot Improves Immunity, Israeli Study Suggests
summary: Early data on those aged 60 and above come as U.S. and other countries plan additional doses to increase protection against Delta variant. TEL AVIV-Early data from Israel suggests a booster shot of Pfizer Inc.'s Covid-19 vaccine can significantly improve immunity in those aged 60 and above, as the U.S. and other countries plan additional doses to increase protection against the highly infectious Delta variant.

title: Glimmerglass Festival Review: Opera Under the Open Sky
summary: This year's festival moved outdoors due to Covid-19 and included 'The Magic Flute,' 'Gods and Mortals,' 'Il Trovatore' and 'The Passion of Mary Cardwell Dawson.'. Cooperstown, N.Y.

title: Biden Administration Proposes Asylum Overhaul to Reduce Backlog, Speed Deportations
summary: The proposed rule would allow U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services asylum officers to hear and decide applications for migrants. The Biden administration released its proposal Wednesday for overhauling the asylum system, aiming to speed up the time it takes for asylum-seekers to receive decisions and to reduce a growing backlog of pending cases.

title: The Best Books to Read on the Beach, According to Surfer John John Florence and Others
summary: A champion surfer, a travel photographer and a writer on the volumes that make for absorbing beach books-and put you in a summer mood. SUMMER MIGHT be winding down but there's one sure-fire way to hold on to the season: sinking into a book. Not just any volume will do-you can save all 1,300 pages of Robert Caro's "The Power Broker: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York" for October. For a read that breezes by whether you're on the beach, in a hammock or sprawled out on a lawn, we asked three notables for their recommendations. Here, a two-time world surfing champion, a photographer known for his beachscapes and a literature professor share their picks for engaging reads that capture the essence of summer and remind them of its inimitable allure. Their answers run the gamut, from a favorite children's book ideal for lazy lakeside vacations to a coming-of-age tale set in Harlem to a classic science-fiction novel that inspires as well as entertains.

title: In California's Sonoma Valley, a Modern Farmhouse With a Speakeasy Asks $16.7 Million
summary: Other amenities at the 'kid magnet' home include a tennis pavilion and a bocce court. A decade ago, Katherine and David deWilde set out to turn their Sonoma County vacation property into a "kid magnet" for their children and grandchildren, complete with a bunk room, sports courts and speakeasy. Now the couple is putting the roughly 13-acre compound on the market for $16.7 million.

title: Tencent to Work With Chinese Regulators to Limit Minors' Online Game Time
summary: Tech giant reports slowing revenue growth as Beijing tightens regulations on sector. Tencent Holdings Ltd. pledged to work with Chinese regulators and industry counterparts to manage how minors use online games and said its April-to-June electronic-game revenue rose at its slowest pace since 2019 amid China's intensifying scrutiny of the tech sector.

title: The Return of 'America Held Hostage'
summary: Some 15,000 U.S. citizens and residents are behind Taliban lines. There's no easy way to get them out.. As Taliban forces consolidate their control of Kabul, the nature of the new regime remains somewhat veiled. On the positive side, the jihadist group issued a general pardon to all government workers, some female broadcasters have returned to the air, and prominent ex-officials like former President Hamid Karzai appear to have elected to remain in the country. On the other side of the ledger, Taliban spokesmen would say only that Afghan women will enjoy their full rights under Shariah; girls' schools have been shut down in parts of the country; teenage girls have been forced into marriage with Taliban fighters; and residents report that armed soldiers are searching apartments and taking names. A widely circulated video purports to show the jihadist group's soldiers executing 22 unarmed Afghan army commandos after their surrender.

title: Will the IMF Bankroll the Taliban?
summary: The U.S. needs to stop Afghanistan from receiving$400 million in Special Drawing Rights next week.. Among the thousands of refugees fleeing Kabul was the acting governor of Afghanistan's central bank, Ajmal Ahmady. He tweeted his escape and noted that he was told Taliban fighters were going door to door demanding to know where he was.

title: A 'Kid Magnet' Home With Its Own Speakeasy
summary: Amenities include a bar above the garage, a pool and a grassy sports field.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: U.S. Senators Urge FTC to Probe Tesla's Autopilot Claims
summary: Two Democratic lawmakers fault Tesla, Elon Musk for 'repeated overstatements' of vehicle capabilities. Two U.S. senators are urging the Federal Trade Commission to open a probe into whether Tesla Inc. used deceptive marketing practices involving driver-assistance features that the electric-vehicle maker calls Autopilot and Full Self-Driving.

title: A Modern Farmhouse in the Sonoma Valley
summary: Asking $16.7 million, the property includes a roughly 5,970-square-foot main house and two guest cottages.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Georgia Election Board Orders Review of Fulton County Elections
summary: Investigation could lead to state takeover of elections in most-populous county. ATLANTA-Georgia's State Election Board appointed a panel to investigate past elections in Fulton County, taking a step toward a possible takeover of election operations in the state's most populous county.

title: Yes, Flapper Style Is Back-Just Ask Rihanna
summary: Outfits inspired by the Roaring '20s are surging back into popularity as history repeats itself. MORE THAN A CENTURY after they began, the Roaring '20s continue to exert a potent gravitational pull. The Charleston dance, flappers, the yearslong economic boom followed by a spectacular bust-almost everyone has at least a hazy idea of the Jazz Age story arc. The era's foremost chronicler, F. Scott Fitzgerald, characterized the American experience of the decade as "a whole race going hedonistic, deciding on pleasure." In fact, the party was global, and with good reason: After an appalling few years, in which millions died first in a war and then in a terrifying pandemic, a headlong pursuit of amusement was the automatic, understandable response.

title: The Taliban's Swift Victory Was Years in the Making
summary: Resume Subscription. The first major Afghan city fell on Aug. 9. The last one, Kabul, capitulated just six days later. The offensive that returned the Taliban to power 20 years after they were ousted by a U.S.-led coalition seemed dizzyingly fast.

title: Candidate Biden vs. President Biden
summary: His foreign policy may be more similar to Donald Trump's than he realizes.. James Freeman is away.

title: Afghan Vets in Congress Try to Prevent 'a Death Warrant' for Helping U.S.
summary: Lawmakers helping people flee country have been given one email address and phone number to submit information to State Department. WASHINGTON-The texts have been flowing into Rep. Brian Mast's phone for days, from veterans in touch with their former Afghan interpreters and military commanders worried about Afghan colleagues, vouching for their risk and pleading for their safe passage out of the country.

title: Comcast, ViacomCBS Team Up for European Streaming Service SkyShowtime
summary: Media giants plan to launch the new paid streaming service across Europe next year. Comcast Corp. and ViacomCBS Inc. plan to launch a subscription streaming service next year in more than 20 European territories, reaching 90 million households, the U.S. media companies said Wednesday.

title: Inflation Is Higher in the U.S. Than Elsewhere, but Don't Panic
summary: While prices in the eurozone appear to be rising more slowly, the difference isn't best explained by any inflationary economic policies in Washington. America likes being exceptional, but too much exceptionalism when it comes to inflation is starting to cause concern. A closer look at the data suggests that investors can keep calm.

title: You Can Still Meet the Band After the Show-Just Keep Your Distance
summary: VIP meetups with groups like O-Town and LFO used to be all hugs, high-fives and small talk, but the pandemic has made everything really awkward. XENIA, Ohio-Back on the road, Brad Fischetti, the last surviving member of the pop-rap trio LFO, drew cheers from fans of the group's 1999 hit single "Summer Girls" during a recent show at the Caesar Ford Park amphitheater.

title: Coinbase Builds a $4 Billion Cash Pile to Weather Tighter Regulation, Crypto Risks
summary: The cryptocurrency exchange plans to use its cash to expand and prepare for higher compliance costs, CFO says. Coinbase Global Inc. in its first months as a public company has built a $4 billion cash stockpile as it benefits from a trading frenzy and prepares for closer regulatory scrutiny.

title: The Politics of Regulation Intrude on Fed Succession
summary: Banks got safer under Chairman Jerome Powell; some Democrats still want someone else to run the Fed. If the Federal Reserve's management of the economy were all that mattered, Chairman Jerome Powell would probably be cruising toward reappointment. His response to the pandemic and focus on full employment have drawn bipartisan praise.

title: Some Afghan Military Fled Taliban Takeover in U.S.-Supplied Aircraft
summary: Dozens of planes and aircraft were piloted by Afghan service members to neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Tajikistan. A large portion of the Afghan Air Force has ended up in neighboring Uzbekistan, after hundreds of Afghan service members used U.S.-supplied planes and helicopters to flee the Taliban, U.S. officials said.

title: Target, Alibaba, Moderna: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Fed minutes due Wednesday could clarify when the central bank will begin to tighten policy. Futures are slipping ahead of the release of minutes from the Federal Reserve's July policy meeting. Here's what we're watching before Wednesday's opening bell.

title: Freddie Mac's New Compliance Chief on Lessons Learned From Previous Crises
summary: Jerry Mauricio became the mortgage giant's senior vice president and chief compliance officer in July. Freddie Mac has named Jerry Mauricio as its senior vice president and chief compliance officer, an appointment coming as the mortgage giant looks to become free of government conservatorship after more than 12 years.

title: Pinterest Expands Its Inclusive Search Tools to Include Hair
summary: The new feature, which enables users to filter search results by six hair patterns, is an effort by the social-media platform to become more inclusive. Pinterest Inc. is introducing a feature that enables people searching for certain hair styles to filter results by six hair patterns: protective, coily, curvy, wavy, straight and shaved or bald.

title: Stephen King, J.K. Rowling and Others Whose 'Not-for-Sale' Books Are Fetching Thousands
summary: Early versions of popular novels have become hot commodities on secondary markets. Not everyone is pleased.. "Not for sale," reads the fine print on the back of an advance reader copy (ARC) of Sally Rooney's forthcoming novel, Beautiful World, Where Are You, which days ago sold on eBay for $79.99 (with tote bag). Another advance copy sold earlier this summer for around $200-roughly 10 times what it costs to preorder the hardcover. An ARC of Jonathan Franzen's forthcoming Crossroads was recently listed on eBay for $165.

title: Carbon Offset Deal Helps Michigan Cash In on Its Trees
summary: Resume Subscription. VANDERBILT, Mich.-The Pigeon River Country State Forest generates cash from timber sales, oil-and-gas leases, hunting licenses and camping fees. Now the foresters who look after its towering red pine, bleach-barked aspen and elk will manage the roughly 110,000 acres for a new moneymaker: carbon offsets.

title: Australia Vaccinates Thousands of High-School Students to Stop Delta
summary: With end-of-school exams nearing, authorities redirected shots meant for rural areas to Sydney suburbs deemed Covid-19 hot spots. SYDNEY-High-school students were never meant to be early recipients of a Covid-19 vaccine in Australia: Authorities gave priority to older residents considered to be more at risk of being hospitalized or dying from the virus.

title: Tencent Looks Abroad as Beijing Tightens the Screws at Home
summary: Tencent's overseas expansion can soften the blow from regulatory ire at home. China's Tencent has lost $411 billion in market value since January as regulatory concerns pummel the stock. Going abroad could be a way to keep growing without so much political risk-particularly for games, which haven't shown up on foreign regulators' radar the way social-media platforms like TikTok have.

title: Just Eat Takeaway.com Gets Lost in Translation
summary: The European food-delivery company faces integrational challenges ahead. Confusing its investors won't help.. Shares of Amsterdam-based Just Eat Takeaway.com, also known as "Jet," have significantly underperformed U.S.-based food delivery peers over the past year. The irony of that shortfall is the company's dominance in a fast-growing industry. A June presentation shows more than 95% of Jet's European gross merchandise value comes from countries where the company has the leading market position.

title: BuzzFeed Clashed With NBCUniversal as It Pursued SPAC Deal
summary: Chief Executive Jonah Peretti of BuzzFeed signed off on terms that could put more pressure on the company if its shares don't rise. He is confident investors will be pleased with the results.. As BuzzFeed Inc. was exploring plans to go public earlier this year, it ran into a problem: Executives at the digital-media outlet's biggest investor, NBCUniversal, thought they were getting a bad deal.

title: Target Sales Increase as Shoppers Return to Stores
summary: Chain says store and online traffic rose 12.7% in July quarter, adding that it is prepared for volatility from the Delta variant. Target Corp. reported increased revenue in the second quarter as more people returned to stores and online spending moderated compared with last summer, when the Covid-19 pandemic upended shopping habits.

title: Pork Giant's Shares Tumble After Father-Son Feud Intensifies
summary: WH Group's stock fell 11% after the son of the Chinese company's chairman publicly accused his father of financial misdeeds. Shares of the world's largest pork producer tumbled 11% Wednesday after the son of the Chinese company's billionaire chairman publicly accused his father of financial misdeeds.

title: A Financial Boost for Rugby's All Blacks Meets Resistance in New Zealand
summary: A proposed investment by U.S. private equity firm Silver Lake is meant to lift both the iconic national team and the game at all levels. Not everyone wants outside help.. No country has won more rugby world cups than New Zealand. No brand is bigger in the global game than its All Blacks.

title: For Robot Trucks, Navigating Highways Is Just One Bump in the Road
Austin Is Capital of Homes Selling at Super Premiums
summary: Texas city's job growth and cultural appeal attracting buyers ready to pay $100,000 or more above asking price. AUSTIN, Texas-A homebuying frenzy is gripping much of the U.S., but Austin takes the prize for the biggest increase in homes selling well above the asking price.

title: Rift Forms on Didi's Board Following Beijing's Regulatory Assault
summary: Top executives from Tencent and Alibaba were surprised and furious upon learning that Didi was in trouble with China's cybersecurity regulator.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: PG&E Blacks Out Some Customers to Reduce California Wildfire Risks
summary: The pre-emptive power shut-offs, the company's first this wildfire season, are a response to high winds poised to hit the state. PG&E Corp. said it was cutting off electricity Tuesday to as many as 51,000 customers in heavily forested parts of Northern California to reduce the risk that its power equipment will spark wildfires.

title: Pelosi Braces for Showdown With Moderates Over Infrastructure Vote
summary: Some Democrats want to vote on infrastructure bill alone while House speaker intends to pair it with $3.5 trillion broader measure. WASHINGTON-Top House Democrats said the chamber would move forward with voting on the budget blueprint for a $3.5 trillion healthcare, education and climate package next week, rebuffing demands from a group of centrist Democrats to first vote on a $1 trillion infrastructure bill and urging their caucus to stay unified around President Biden's agenda.

title: Taliban Consolidate Control in Afghanistan's Capital
summary: Resume Subscription. The Biden administration said Tuesday that the airport in Kabul was open for both military and civilian flights, but access remained near-impossible for the thousands of Afghans seeking to leave Afghanistan, as the Taliban strengthened control over the city and a Taliban leader returned from exile.

title: Florida Votes to Punish School Districts Over Mask Mandates
summary: Districts in Alachua County, home to Gainesville, and Broward County, including Fort Lauderdale, threatened with funding cuts. MIAMI-The Florida Board of Education voted unanimously to punish two school districts for implementing mask mandates that ran afoul of a state order barring such requirements.
